document.docAuthor: Giroti, André Marsola & Brescovit, Antonio Domingos
document.docTitle: Ariadna reginae Giroti & Brescovit 2018, new species
document.masterDocTitle: The taxonomy of the American Ariadna Audouin (Araneae: Synspermiata: Segestriidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The taxonomy of the American Ariadna Audouin (Araneae: Synspermiata: Segestriidae)

Diagnosis.
Ariadna reginae
n. sp.
is similar to
A. obscura
,
A. tarsalis
,
A. arthuri
,
A. multispinosa
and
A. aurea
n. sp.
due to the morphology of the male metatarsi I ( Figs 16C‒E , 32C‒E , 38C‒E , 54C‒E , 56C‒E ) and macrosetae pattern of the tibia I‒II of females, but males differ by the presence slightly sinuous metatarsi I, with a ventroprolateral apophysis in the distal region, bearing a thickened macrosetae ( Fig. 54C‒E ); females differ, except
A. obscura
, by the presence of a ventral lobe with expanded tip. It differs from
A. obscura
by presenting sinuous lobes and smaller glandular ducts plate ( Fig. 55C‒D ).

Etymology. The specific name is in honor of Regina Maria Marsola Giroti, mother of André Marsola Giroti, who, together with his father João Jair Giroti, has given him the gift of life, struggling to provide the means for a good life and education.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 54.
Ariadna reginae
n. sp.
. Male (Paratype) from 11km ESE La Virgen (INBIO 4407641) (A‒E): habitus, dorsal (A) and ventral view (B); right leg I, prolateral (C) and retrolateral view (D); right metatarsus I, ventral view (E). Female (Paratype) from 4km SE Puerto Viejo de Sarapiqui (CAS 9046549) (F‒I): habitus, dorsal (F) and ventral view (G); right leg I, prolateral (H) and retrolateral view (I). Scale bar: 1mm.

FIGURE 55.
Ariadna reginae
n. sp.
. Male (Paratype) from 11km ESE La Virgen (INBIO 4407641) (A‒B): left palp, prolateral (A) and retrolateral view (B). Female (Paratype) from 4km SE Puerto Viejo de Sarapiqui (CAS 9046549) (C‒D): internal genitalia, lateral view (E); anterior receptaculum, ventral view (F). Scale bar: 1mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. Male (n=10): Total length 2.8‒3.72; carapace 1.38‒1.92 long, 1.02‒1.42 wide; femur I 1.4‒1.76. Female (n=10): Total length 2.88‒6.56; carapace 1.6‒2.7 long, 1.04‒1.82 wide; femur I 1.06‒1.94.

Distribution.
Mexico
,
Guatemala
,
Belize
and Costa Rica ( Fig. 68 ).
